Dont waste your money here, go to Esplinade.  Cheaper tickets, all chairs recline and you get full bar and food  service to your seat no matter where you sit.  Plus they have reliable screen and volume quality control.

IPic is a fun experience for a date and a good meal.   This place is great to get your grub on and catch a cool flick.  At first we couldn't find it, but eventually we found our way, its upstairs and is a little swanky but you would expect that when watching a movie in this manner.

I ordered the fish and chips and they did really pretty good.

We got the Premium Plus Seating which is extra but I would recommend, since you are already there, you might as well as take it all in...and we did. The seats are extremely comfy, you can kick back and enjoy the show as you lounge back.

Also, the service here is delightful good to you, bar none.  IPIC YOU!

I love Ipic. I just moved here from IL and was super excited to see that there was an Ipic out here. 
Anyway... This location has a beautiful lobby. I appreciate that there is more premium plus seating. I also appreciate the individual swivel tables. And the service was great. 

Only thing to improve are the upholstery. It's stained and kinda gross. I looks like they clean them as best they can; but that fabric stains. They should change to leather like they did at the Bolingbrook, IL location. It's cool enough in there so you won't stick to it.
Not your average theater.  We love the whole experience and we will come again next time we visit Scottsdale.

Literally the worst hospitality experience of my entire life.  I was using my phone to review the dessert menu as I was approached by a staff member that spoke to me so offensively I was left completely insulted.  Within seconds of being made aware of my phone light, I immediately placed it in my pocket.  Yet instead of thanking me for complying to his wishes he continued to lecture and speak to me in an unforgiving tone for minutes after and finished by asking me, "If I'd like to leave the theater?"  

At this time, I finally spoke and simply explained that I was reading the dessert menu.  Only to again be rudely mistreated.  Never once did he say excuse me, my apologies, I'm sorry, please or thank you.  Instead I was reprimanded and lectured at by a man the chose to speak to me in a highly condescending tone.

Thing is, I had no problem putting my phone away but the person asking should be respectful and ask politely.  Also I'm quite sure no one actually complained as we never witnessed anyone getting out of their seat and my phone use was brief.  Why not just be kind, honest and spare the paying customer the lies and senseless embellishment?

Long story short, I wanted to leave the movie halfway through.  Although this was a birthday gift to my mother and  I was stuck enduring the remainder of the film all the while feeling enraged.  The evening was completely ruined of what was supposed to be a very fun and pleasant celebration.  Not to mention an expensive one at that.  Nothing like paying someone well over a $100 for a movie so some jerk can treat you like  .  Needless to say, I will never return here again.

My husband and I visited the Scottsdale location last night and was really surprised by the lackluster service. We have been here plenty of times and was always met with exceptional service. Last night was terrible! Our meals were cold when we received them. We had to ask for silverware and were given them halfway through our meal. They completely forgot our condiments and never offered to refill our drinks. Terribly disappointed especially when we spent over $100 and was really looking forward to date night.

To be clear: the movie I saw was half filled with patrons. With that said--Love the theater but the service was awful. The building and the decor are gorgeous; Immaculately clean and no old popcorn smell. The premium plus seating was so inviting and comfy it makes you feel like you were at home( recliner, blanket and pillow).   That's pretty much where the wow factor ends for me. The "complimentary" popcorn was cold and tasteless but that was expected. The waiters took really long to even acknowledge us although people who entered after were treated with all sorts of pomp and circumstance. When we finally got the waiter's attention the guy did not get my order correct ( or the kitchen decided medium is the same as a well done steak) and took half the movie to bring a single glass of wine. I felt completely ignored and disregarded at the end. For what they charge, I expected better service to go with such a nice environment. My advice: order before and take your food /drink in; those waiters will just let you down.

Just returned from seeing Wonder Woman on opening night. Had heard this theater was very nice and thought it would be fun to go there and enjoy the reserved cushy seats and a glass of wine... well, not so much. Beautiful lobby, but the cool bar was closed on a Thursday night. So went to sit down early. Comfy seats, really not any better than the deluxe seats at AMC but they give you a small pillow and blanket. The wine came, the movie started, all was well. Till the large group came in 10 minutes after the movie started, and proceed to loudly discuss and order a full meal. I missed about 5 minutes of dialogue, but sure knew exactly what they were having for dinner. Worse, they kept turning on their phone in flashlight mode to read their menus. Seriously, it affected the picture quality - this was a small theater. And they did this several times during the movie. Totally ruined what I thought would be a great experience. And paying $16/ticket PLUS a $9 surcharge, I was expecting a great experience after shelling out $50. Never again. I know this really wasn't the theater's fault, but you would think ordering dinner would have to happen before the start of the movie, or at least have late arrivals place their order before entering. If you love movies and want a high-quality experience, this is not the place.

My husband, myself, and the in-laws were at iPic to watch The King's Speech in the Gold level section. 

The seating was ample (including reclining for my husband who is 6'1"), comfortable, and offered everything a regular movie theater lacks. My husband had chips with blue cheese and I had a glass of rose champagne. The service was great and on point. I was skeptical before arriving due to the mixed reviews, but thankfully everything was great!

From now on, my husband and I decided iPic will be our choice if we have a movie date night. The cost of a gold-level ticket, if you're a member is $17.50 per person; totaling $35.00 for a couple. The ticket includes free popcorn. Considering the comfort, service, and price, you get the better end of the deal at iPic.

WORST SERVICE EVER. 
My date and I decided to come here for good service, food, and drinks. Because it's supposed to be "fine dining"? we paid almost $60 for our tickets, the movie started at 10:15 and we never got greeted. I waited till 10:55 to go down, miss part of my movie and speak to the manager. He has another server come up, that server realizes that We had no water, no free popcorn, and no menus. By the time we were greeted, the movie was over half way over. He bring us water and says "your server will be right with you" the server never came back. Then she decided to come up and say "it's last call is there anything else I can grab for you" as if she had already taken care of us. I'm not happy with the service. I'm SHOCKED that the GM didnt give us a refund or send something complimentary up for the terrible service. I'm in the bar industry I also work in fine dining. I know how guests are supposed to be treated but I've been treated better at a McDonald's.

Date night with the hubby... Ughhh where do I start. I've visited Ipic many times and have always loved my experience. You do pay extra $$$ for the comfortable premium seats, the service and overall experience. Why pay 50+ for tickets for your waiter to be gone most of the time and not even come by and check on drinks. I normally will have a couple cocktails however the waitress came over and was rude when asking what we wanted to drink. I ordered their prickly Rita and my hubby the Long Island... What do we get? Who knows it was gross. I decided to ask for a glass of wine and from that point on I never saw our waitress again.... Even until the movie ended we had to walk out the theatre and look for her to sign off on my tab. What happened to this place? No service, fowl smelling blankets, and unkept bathroom. Don't know if I will come back.

So yesterday was my first experience at Ipic and I must say I was not disappointed. Everything about the place screams luxury and truly was such a great experience from the waiters, bartenders, bathrooms and comfortable seating everything lived up to expectation. I would say the only negative would be that our movie started at 11:15 and we couldn't get into the theatre until 11:07 which made it feel a bit rushed. I like to sit relax and enjoy before my movie starts but other than that I truly enjoyed myself. I will certainly be back again!

We love to see movies at the Ipic!  With that said in order to have a great experience you must take note of the following:  

1. Premium seats only!  The forward seats are very uncomfortable. The headrest pushes your head downward, so u get a terrible kink in your neck trying to compensate to see the screen.  
2. Waitstaff hit or miss! Let your waitstaff know u will settle the bill once the movie is OVER.  Twice I have had them interrupt the movie at the most climactic moment to discuss the bill?  You know: did I want anything else?  Should they put it on the credit card they had? Ect.  When you pay this much to see a movie, you want to SEE the movie.
3.  Some of the food is pretty good some not so much.  Probably still better to grab something at TruFood, Zinburger ect before you go to see the movie.

Best parts: popcorn served as part of the experience and covered as part of the price.  Reclining seats (although some of these are getting a bit ratty).  Having someone wait on you if you order in the premium seats. Also staff at front desk always very nice!

After seeing so many positive reviews, I have to say I just don't get it.  I prebooked our tickets online, which was easy.  I was a little taken back at the price. $17 for each seat and they are not even the seats that recline. I was also surprised that after checking in, we ordered our own food and they don't bring it to us.  I mean for $17 a seat I would think we would get service, but apparently if you want service the seats are $27 each.  I don't mind paying more for good service and food, but this is a little off the charts for me.  Anyway, we were seated and then had to leave to get our food and missed the beginning of the movie.  We ordered the thai chili shrimp - very nice, the bite size nachos- vey flavorful, and a fajita quesadilla- all of which were very good appys.  The tray attached to the seat just holds the plate and they don't have drink holders- at least in these "coach" seats, so it gets tight.  The lady next to us spilled her drink because of the lack of space. And then you sit there and watch the movie with your dirty plate in front you.  Classy!    At least we saw a good movie. Overall, the ambiance is very nice, but for three people to see a movie and have some appys we were out $115.  With AMC and SMG being so close this place is the equivalent of driving around in a Hummer when gas prices are sky high. Why do it? AMC has lovely seats that recline and Studio Movie Grill includes friendly service in their theaters for no up charge.
Very expensive (about $16 a ticket) but absolutely worth it! An incredible movie experience. I love the huge leather chairs and in-theater alcohol access

The quality of the picture sucked. Honestly, it wasn't even close to as good as my tv at home. Plus, the movie theater tries to screw you over when you book tickets through the website - the entire booking / reserve seat process is literally backward. What appears to be the front of the theater is actually the back. Therefore, we were WAY too close to the screen when we thought we were going to be in the back. It wasn't a good experience, gave us a headache, and wasn't worth 2 bucks much less $18.50 per person. What a ripoff!!!!!! If it wasn't for the buckets of beer, this experience would have been worthless. I will never go here again. Complete waste of money.

The new iPic Theaters in swanky Scottsdale Quarter is something to write home about, but probably only once in a blue moon, unfortunately. A cool experience or date that comes with a restrictive price tag for most folks -- if I didn't have free tickets, it would have taken a special occasion to get my butt in that seat.

What I liked:
- The atmosphere of the facility -- think movie theater mated with upscale night club.
- The seats -- comfortable recliners, but only if you pay for the upgraded "gold package," which is really the way to go here. The 'regular' seats looked pretty regular. The upgrade gets you free popcorn, blankets and pillows, and waiter service. You can also reserve these seats in advance.
- Food and drink: nice selection, decent quality (especially the wine selection)
- The bathrooms were super nice.

What I didn't like:
- Prices: holy crap. You can easily spend over $100 for a movie date here.  The least-expensive glass of non-house wine is $12. The average appetizer is around $12 as well. The quality of the food did not meet my expectations for those prices. 
- Pretentiousness -- people dressed like clubgoers, rather than as movie patrons. Servers in the theater push you to order food and drink. 

Overall a cool experience, but I wonder how this place will sustain itself once the novelty wears off. I wish them luck.

Probably the most upscale movie theater I've ever been to. You'll definitely want to reserve tickets well in advance and if you want the fancy seats you'll pay more. 

Food and drink menu is quite lavish. I had a coconut/pineapple mocktail that was awesome. I would definitely order it again. My husband had a cocktail he enjoyed too. All of the food was excellent. Definitely pricey but you're paying for the service and convenience. 

Very nice place to come for special occasions!

Gorgeous theater lobby almost like a Broadway theater. I had my own personal screening for Railway Man last night. No one was there but me. That was awesome. (great Flic by the way) I had a free ticket from a Gatsby costume contest last year so that helped. This place is very nice but hilatiously expensive. A night out here will cost you dearly between Valet, ticket price, and 15 dollar soda and dessert. I can not imagine if you ate here. That must be close to a sixty dollar evening.  So while this is very nice, it is an only once in a while treat. The theater itself is very swanky. You get a blanket, pillow and lounger chairs.( do not fall asleep lol) Oh yeah, and this might be an odd comment, but I find the bathrooms here breathtaking. lol-They are so, so nice.  See I still have a little girly, girl and Ny finery left in me.

My wife and I decided to catch a afternoon movie, a rare treat with a two year old, and decided to go to the Ipic theatre. We had previously gone to a cineopolis in del mar, California, which was a fantastic experience. Unfortunately, this was not nearly as good a experience. 
For starters, the price was steep, even for luxury cinemas standards. This in itself wouldn't have been too bad if you'd get what you pay for. In my opinion we did not get that. The theatre is nice looking, and the bathrooms are modern and very clean. The staff was helpful with one exception, but I'll get to that. The absolute biggest disappointment of the afternoon was the seats. For $25 per seat I'd expect a comfortable seat and a Unobstructed view. I'm 6'1 and the handrail going up the aisles was blocking out the bottom corner of the screen, minor perhaps, but at that price I expect better. The seat itself was old, and either a metal or wood bar in the back of the seat was stabbing me in the lower back. I thought "maybe it's just this one seat", but nope, my wife had the exact same issue. It would have been comfortable enough if not for those bars. As it was though, they quite literally kept me from enjoying the movie. My feet were basically hanging over the woman in front of me, it was slightly embarrassing and uncomfortable. Thankfully we didn't have any feet above us, being in the last row, otherwise I don't think I would have stayed. 
The food, while expected to be overpriced, was tiny and a la carte. Fries are $9 extra. Ouch. Do I dare look what I paid for that cup of ice (with some soda to fill the spaces)? The service was decent, though I'd have preferred a button to call the guy, vs him just showing up during the movie at times.
$26 for a plate with a appetizer as a side and a piece of pie the size of my thumb. Ouch again. 
The movie would have been so much more enjoyable if those seats hadn't made my entire lower body go numb. Am I regressing?
Finally, the torture in the seats was over and we were leaving. While waiting for my wife, I mentioned the uncomfortable seats to the girl manning the podium where she checks your tickets. She looked at me like I was blank wall. I don't know if my comment just didn't register with her, or if she couldn't believe my audacity to mention something so unthinkable to her. Either way, she just gave me a blank stare and said nothing. I walked away. 
So there is a nice AMC luxury cinema in town? Guess where I'm going next time.
Sorry, but this was a fail for Ipic theatres.

This was my second experience at iPic and it truly exceeded my expectations once again. I brought 13 of my close friends to help celebrate my birthday watching Breaking Dawn (11/26/2011) in the Premium Plus Seating. As if huge recliner chairs weren't enough, the complimentary pillow, blanket and popcorn will win you over. During the movie the very knowledgeable and helpful staff served our entrée's and drinks only to be guided after into the Salt lounge where we had a table, appetizers and bottle service waiting. It is definitely a great spot for any special occasion! I can't wait to come back!

The iPic experience is excellent and the venue is first-class. The negatives would be 1) the cost and 2) the service hasn't been as attentive the past few times we have been there.

Overall, I would still recommend it.
